page.title: 09FESTIVALS IN GRETTON
page.content: Festivals are held regularly in the village at various times of the year. The first one is the May Fair at the Primary School when a May Queen is crowned and Maypole Dancing takes place. There are also stalls and P.E. displays. During the summer months both Churches hold Flower Festivals, when the numerous visitors can appreciate the many displays representing different themes from the Bible. From the donations given by the visitors the Churches raise much money. The school and both Churches also hold Harvest Festivals and give the proceeds to charity. On the nearest Sunday to 11th. November a Festival of Rememb- rance is held to honour the men who died in the two world wars. Services are held at either the Parish Church or the Baptist Church followed by the laying of wreathes on the war memorial.
